label: Or. 12.885, f010

metadata.label: Cutting lines
metadata.value: The original cutting line has been preserved on the top and partially on the left sides only.

metadata.label: Further remarks
metadata.value: Verso: Nine lines belonging to a letter which is incomplete on all sides are written with a thick pen. Starting from line 3, five lines of a different text are written over the left side of the original text with a thin pen. Of this text only the basmala can be read with certainty.

metadata.label: Content description
metadata.value:
Recto: The sender writes that he has received textiles and dirhams as well as a letter from the addressee. The sender in turn has sent the addressee with the deliverer of the present letter a piece of good cloth of first quality treated by a certain Abū al-Ḥasan (ll. 2-3). The sender gives an account presumably of money owed to him amounting to twenty dirhams of which he has received only eleven minus one dāniq so far. A third person, named Abū al-Ḥasan, is mentioned twice in the letter (ll. 4, 9).
 
Verso:  The first letter conveys a request from the sender to the addressee to be completed as soon as the latter has read the sender's letter (l. 2). the letter contains more commands for the addressee.
